business.headline: Crypto in slump. 3 reasons why Bitcoin, Ethereum and Dogecoin are strugglingThe cryptocurrency market is struggling, and major tokens are taking the hit. Bitcoin, Ethereum, and Dogecoin have all dropped as investors react to a mix of macroeconomic uncertainty, liquidations, and upcoming market events.

EPFO 3.0 roll-out likely delayed, ATM withdrawals pushed to 2026The wait for EPFO 3.0 just got longer. While the update is set to make provident fund services more seamless, its highlight feature, ATM withdrawals, is now likely to come into effect in 2026.

Why Trump's MAGA is impossible without Indian CEOsThe list of Indian-origin CEOs in global technology and beyond is long and growing. Satya Nadella leads Microsoft, Sundar Pichai is at Alphabet and Google, Arvind Krishna heads IBM, Shantanu Narayen runs Adobe, and Neal Mohan was appointed YouTube CEO in 2023.

Trump slaps 100% tariff on branded pharma drug imports: Should India worry?For now, experts say that India's generic drug exports remain largely safe, though any future extension of US tariffs to generics could disrupt the sector and investor sentiment.
Dalal Street outlook: Is market entering a consolidation phase?

Cipla, Dr. Reddy's, Sun Pharma: Why pharma stocks are falling todayAt 9:39 am, Sun Pharma fell 2.94% to Rs 1,548, Cipla dropped 1.92% to Rs 1,475, and Dr. Reddy's Laboratories slipped 1.17% to Rs 1,275. The sector's decline added to the broader weakness in equity markets.

Pharma stocks drag stock markets lower after Trump's 100% drug tariff threatAt 9:24 am, the S&P BSE Sensex was down 240.39 points at 80,919.29, while the NSE Nifty50 slipped 86.30 points to 24,804.55. Broader market indices also mirrored the weakness.

Exclusive: Adani set to acquire Sahara's crown jewel assets in landmark dealThe deal stems from a long-running dispute ongoing before the Supreme Court led by the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi) against key Sahara entities, requiring them to refund investor money.

Ananya Birla on building Swatantra, making music, and leading with valuesWhether running businesses, writing songs, or leading teams, Ananya Birla believes in giving her all. Speaking at the India Today Conclave Mumbai 2025, she reflected on her early start, her discipline, and the values that guide her.

Ananya Birla on balancing business, music, and leadershipAnanya Birla wears many hats - entrepreneur, musician, and leader. At the India Today Conclave Mumbai 2025, she shared how discipline, values, and passion have helped her navigate each role with purpose.

CBDT extends deadline for filing income tax audit reports to October 31CBDT said the move comes in response to representations from professional bodies, including Chartered Accountant associations, highlighting difficulties in completing audit reports on time.

Sensex tumbles over 500 points, Nifty falls below 25,000The Nifty 50 slipped 0.66% to 24,890.85, while the BSE Sensex eased 0.68% to 81,159.68, logging their longest losing run since early March. Over the past five sessions, the Nifty and Sensex have fallen 2.1% and 2.2%, respectively.

entertainment.headline: Meet Anya Singh: The rising star winning hearts in The Ba***ds of Bollywood Anya Singh's performance in 'The Ba***ds of Bollywood' has earned widespread recognition. The actor's journey from a non-filmy background to the spotlight highlights her determination and growing influence in Indian entertainment.

Bigg Boss 19 episode 33: Baseer apologises to Awez's family, Nagma Baseer Ali apologised to Awez Darbar's family and his girlfriend, and ex-Bigg Boss 19 contestant Nagma Mirajkar. He had previously claimed that Awez was disloyal to Nagma. In episode 33, Awez saw a clip of Baseer talking about the same with Amaal Mallik and Zeishan Quadri.

Nagarjuna, Tabu, Sreeleela and celebs dazzle at Kalyanaraman family's Navratri Puja Like every year, the Kalyanaraman family's Navratri celebrations in Thrissur, Kerala, were a grand event with a bevy of stars present. Take a look at who all attended the puja.

Farah Khan denies ignoring Aayush Sharma in viral video Farah Khan has dismissed claims of ignoring Aayush Sharma at an event as nonsense, clarifying that she did not see him in the rush and recently shot a vlog with him.

Parineeti, Imtiaz elated on Amar Singh Chamkila's International Emmy nomination After Diljit Dosanjh, actor Parineeti Chopra and director Imtiaz Ali expressed joy and gratitude as 'Amar Singh Chamkila' secured International Emmy nominations. The film has been nominated in the Best Actor and Best TV Movie categories.

Case against Pawan Kalyan fans for creating chaos at OG screening in Bengaluru Trouble has mounted for Pawan Kalyan fans after they created a chaos at a Bengaluru theatre. The film released in theatres on September 25.

Homebound cleared with 11 cuts, cricket scene trimmed, certain dialogues muted Filmmaker Neeraj Ghaywan's 'Homebound' was cleared by the censor board with 11 cuts. The film's runtime was also shortened by 77 seconds.

OG box office Day 1: Pawan Kalyan's film explodes to massive Rs 100-crore haul Pawan Kalyan's 'They Call Him OG' smashed Rs 100 crore on its opening day, including paid premieres. The gangster drama, directed by Sujeeth, has received glowing reviews from fans.

Farhan Akhtar moved by Dwayne Johnson's The Smashing Machine: Can't wait to see Dwayne Johnson impressed fans with his physical transformation in the upcoming biopic 'The Smashing Machine'. After getting international recognition, the film found a fan in Bolllywood actor Farhan Akhtar.

Janaawar review: Bhuvan Arora' show delivers hard-hitting take on caste, society 'Janaawar: The Beast Within' is a gripping crime drama set in a small town, with Bhuvan Arora shining as a cop balancing duty and family. The series explores caste, identity, and the darker sides of human nature. Read our review.

International Emmy Awards 2025 nominations full list: Chamkila, Ludwig get nods 2025 International Emmy nominations feature 64 contenders from 26 countries. United Kingdom leads with 12 nominations, followed by Brazil and South Africa. 'Ludwig' and 'Amar Singh Chamkila' received multiple nods.

Bhumi Pednekar on trolls: Resilience keeps me going in tough times Actor Bhumi Pednekar at India Today Mumbai Conclave on facing trolls, resilience, box-office lows, and finding courage beyond cinema.

Diljit Dosanjh, Amar Singh Chamkila nominated for International Emmys Diljit Dosanjh has earned an International Emmy nomination for Best Actor for his role in 'Amar Singh Chamkila', which is also competing for Best TV Movie, marking a global recognition of the legendary singer's story.

Video: Ektaa Kapoor talks Kyunki, motherhood and National Award win for Kathal Producer Ektaa Kapoor spoke about 'Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi', motherhood and more during her appearance at India Today Conclave Mumbai 2025. She was present at the session titled 'Queen of Content: Woman Who Shaped Indian Screens'.

Did Ektaa Kapoor take a dig at Ram Kapoor's weight loss? Producer breaks silence Ektaa Kapoor shuts down speculation linking her post to Ram Kapoor, calling it a wild misinterpretation.
"I was talking about body image, not taking a dig," she said while speaking on Day One of India Today Conclave Mumbai 2025.

Varun Dhawan on Sunny Sanskari vs Kantara clash: There's room for all films Varun Dhawan's upcoming film 'Sunny Sanskari Ki Tulsi Kumari' is a lighthearted entertainer designed to uplift moods rather than preach life lessons. The actor graced India Today Conclave 2025 on Thursday and called the film a mood-lifting entertainer.

Ektaa Kapoor on 30 years of content creation: It's not about success but relevance Ektaa Kapoor spoke on Day 1 of the India Today Conclave Mumbai 2025. She shared insights on her three-decade-long journey, highlighting the importance of relevance over mere success.

Ektaa Kapoor never imagined Kathal would win best film at National Awards Producer Ektaa Kapoor shared her excitement about winning the National Award for her film 'Kathal' at the India Today Mumbai Conclave. She expressed that not in her wildest dreams did she think a dramedy would clinch the award.

We're children of cinema: Kamal Haasan to youngest National Award winner Treesha Kamal Haasan congratulated young Treesha Thosar, who became the youngest recipient to win a National Award at the age of four. The veteran actor won a National Award when he was six years old.

general news.headline: MiG-21 testimony to India-Russia ties, not just aircraft: Rajnath at jet's farewellDefence minister Rajnath Singh said the MiG-21 is not just an aircraft but a testimony to India-Russia ties. He added that from the 1971 war to the Balakot airstrike, the jet has stood as a symbol of strength and valour for the armed forces.

Nato chief claims Modi, hit by tariffs, phoned Putin and asked for Ukraine planNATO Secretary-General Mark Rutte stated that Trump's tariffs on India are affecting Russia, prompting PM Modi to seek clarification from Putin on Moscow's strategy in Ukraine.

Trump slaps 100% tariff on branded pharma drug imports: Should India worry?For now, experts say that India's generic drug exports remain largely safe, though any future extension of US tariffs to generics could disrupt the sector and investor sentiment.

Voter roll revision like note ban, medicine in search of disease: Yogendra YadavWhile addressing a session at the ongoing 2025 India Today Conclave Mumbai, a flagship event of the India Today Group., Yogendra Yadav said, "SIR is not a voter list revision, it is a master, manipulative reset."

Fighter pilots reveal the MiG-21 truth, defend India's war-winnerFor over six decades, the MiG-21 defended India's skies and helped train generations of pilots. Yet, despite its reputation as a workhorse, upgrade and spares woes marred its legacy. As the Indian Air Force (IAF) restores its fleet of MiG-21, pilots who flew it defend the trusted war bird.

Foreign trips, iPhones: How molestation-accused Delhi baba 'lured' women studentsSwami Chaitanyananda Saraswati, the former head of a management institute in Vasant Kunj, is currently on the run after more than 15 women students accused him of molestation, blackmail and intimidation.

What has Lalu's kidney to do with rift in RJD? Didn't daughter Rohini donate it?Just ahead of the Bihar Assembly election, a rift within the RJD's first family is out in the open. In 2022, Lalu Prasad Yadav's daughter, Rohini Acharya, donated her kidney to him in a transplant done in Singapore. Now, questions are being asked if Rohini was actually the donor. While she hints the doubts were being created at the behest of Tejashwi Yadav's trusted aide, Sanjay Yadav, her eldest brother, Tej Pratap Yadav, has sided with her.

Asked about 'U' not getting bail, DY Chandrachud mentions 'P'. What's the case?Former CJI DY Chandrachud stressed that "every single individual who deserved bail got bail" during his tenure. To illustrate, he referred to the case of Congress leader Pawan Khera.

Why Indian elections are mostly free but rarely fairWhile Indian elections have become freer, they are much less fairer. At the heart of electoral democracy is the belief in a 'Level Playing Field' (LPL): every candidate and party who contests should begin from the same starting point. Instead, now we have a totally skewed race where those in power have a massive advantage over their rivals.

Supreme Court clears Rs 20,000-crore JSW acquisition deal for Bhushan SteelA bench led by Chief Justice of India BR Gavai on Friday approved JSW Steel's Rs 19,700-crore resolution plan, saying the company had met all the parameters required.

Farewell MiG-21: Fighter jet says goodbye after 62 stunning years in serviceAt a grand farewell ceremony in Chandigarh, Defence Minister Rajnath Singh, top military leaders, veterans, and families gathered to mark the end of the iconic Soviet-era fighter jet's 62 years of distinguished service.

Why Trump's MAGA is impossible without Indian CEOsThe list of Indian-origin CEOs in global technology and beyond is long and growing. Satya Nadella leads Microsoft, Sundar Pichai is at Alphabet and Google, Arvind Krishna heads IBM, Shantanu Narayen runs Adobe, and Neal Mohan was appointed YouTube CEO in 2023.

The Gucci glow-up: Alia Bhatt's boldest fashion era yetWith over a decade in the film industry, Alia's style has always been a source of inspiration - especially with her ethnic looks and effortlessly relatable choices. But ever since her Gucci contract, she's been pushing the envelope like never before, radiating a true global fashion appeal.

Tamil Nadu Minister says women in North India still judged by husbands, sparks rowTamil Nadu Industries Minister TRB Rajaa sparked controversy by comparing women in Tamil Nadu and North India. BJP's Shehzad Poonawalla criticised the remarks as insulting UP and Bihar women.

Bengaluru shop owner, aide brutally thrash woman accused of saree theft, arrestedA Bengaluru shopkeeper and his aide were arrested for publicly assaulting a woman accused of stealing Rs 91,500 worth of sarees. Videos show her being dragged and kicked. Police also arrested the woman for theft.

Apple Watch Series 11 review: Come for sleep tracking, stay for long battery lifeThe new Apple Watch Series 11 looks and works almost similar to the Watch Series 10. But it does bring better battery life, which makes a real difference in use.

Astronaut shows vein-like patterns in world's largest Amazon RiverIn the image, shared from orbit, the Amazon appears almost like a living organism, its vast network of tributaries branching out like veins across tens of kilometres of floodplain.

Shashi Tharoor's witty comeback to Suhel Seth's Oxford 'sole mate' remark goes viralOn X, Suhel Seth shared a picture from Oxford University, the site where the Oxford English Dictionary was created, and joked that the dictionary was Shashi Tharoor's "sole mate."

Surya asked to avoid political comments over Pak complaints at ICC hearing: SourcesThe ICC has advised India captain Suryakumar Yadav to avoid political statements after a PCB complaint over his tribute following the India-Pakistan group-stage clash. His dedication to Operation Sindoor and Pahalgam attack victims sparked controversy ahead of the Asia Cup final.

What the rupee slide to a new low against a weak dollar meansThe rupee has been pressured by the punishing US tariffs, H-1B visa fee hike and sustained outflows of foreign portfolio investors from India

Homebound cleared with 11 cuts, cricket scene trimmed, certain dialogues mutedFilmmaker Neeraj Ghaywan's 'Homebound' was cleared by the censor board with 11 cuts. The film's runtime was also shortened by 77 seconds.

Doctors aren't called nepo kids, so why us, asks Maharashtra MLA Rohit PawarAt the India Today Conclave, Karjat-Jamkhed MLA Rohit Pawar spoke on the need for policy reforms alongside caste-based reservation, defended his political lineage, and emphasised his focus on Maharashtra's development.

Amazon to pay $2.5 billion for tricking users into unwanted Prime sign-upsAmazon will pay $2.5 billion to settle claims over misleading Prime subscription tactics. The deal aims to improve cancellation processes but leaves Prime's dominance largely intact.

TDP's Nandamuri Balakrishna calls Jagan Reddy 'psycho' in Andhra assembly, stirs rowAndhra Pradesh Assembly saw heated exchanges after TDP MLA Nandamuri Balakrishna called ex-Chief Minister Jagan Mohan Reddy a "psycho" during a law-and-order debate. Chiranjeevi clarified his role in the film industry delegation meeting Jagan Reddy.

sports.headline: Shubman Gill in awe of Smriti Mandhana: She has the lazy elegance of Damien Martyn Women's World Cup: Shubman Gill said Smriti Mandhana plays with the "lazy elegance" of former Australian batter Damien Martyn. Mandhana recently became India's fastest centurion in ODIs.

No Bumrah perks, but Mohammed Shami toiling to keep India comeback dream alive India fast bowler Mohammed Shami is training behind the scenes, hoping to make an India comeback at the age of 35. People close to Shami have been infuriated by the preferential treatment given to some of the other players in the team.

Abhishek Sharma drops stylish Dubai pics, Guru Yuvraj has hilarious response Abhishek Sharma's latest post on Instagram got a hilarious comment from his guru Yuvraj Singh, who decided to have some fun at the expense of his young disciple. Abhishek posted images from his free time in Dubai.

Ashes: Joe Root eyes beyond milestone 100 vs Australia, confident in different England Joe Root promises England will approach the Ashes Down Under with a fresh mindset, that can toruble Australia. While a century in Australia remains elusive, his focus is on winning matches and reclaiming the urn.

PR Sreejesh reveals India senior team coach ambitions, wants World Cup glory In an exclusive interaction with India Today, PR Sreejesh said that he aims to coach the India men's senior team and win the World Cup with them. Sreejesh commented on his life after retirement, his mentor role with SG Pipers and much more.

IND vs WI: West Indies suffer big blow as Shamar Joseph ruled out of series West Indies suffered a big blow ahead of the India Test series as Shamar Joseph has been ruled out of the Test series against India, which will begin on October 2. Shamar has been replaced by Johann Layne in the lineup.

Surya asked to avoid political comments over Pak complaints at ICC hearing: Sources The ICC has advised India captain Suryakumar Yadav to avoid political statements after a PCB complaint over his tribute following the India-Pakistan group-stage clash. His dedication to Operation Sindoor and Pahalgam attack victims sparked controversy ahead of the Asia Cup final.

IND v SL preview: India face dead rubber dilemma ahead of Pakistan final Asia Cup, IND vs SL Super 4 preview: With the final against Pakistan looming, India find themselves caught in the classic dead rubber dilemma — to experiment or to consolidate. Friday's clash with Sri Lanka may not alter the standings, but it offers India a chance to settle questions over form, sharpen their fielding, and build the rhythm they need for the big showdown.

Smriti Mandhana eyes more records after stellar Australia series: Stats Preview Smriti Mandhana has delivered a stunning ODI series against Australia, breaking records with her explosive batting. She now aims for historic milestones at the upcoming Women's World Cup, raising expectations and excitement.

The Wall gets tougher: Sreejesh trades easygoing charm for coaching discipline From being a chill goalkeeper on the field to being a strict taskmaster on the halfway line, PR Sreejesh tells India Today about his coaching style, mentor role with SG Pipers and his ultimate goal as the senior team coach.

Watch: Fans troll Pakistan for fielding blunder vs Bangladesh ahead of India final Pakistan survived a shaky fielding performance to beat Bangladesh by 11 runs in the Asia Cup Super 4, but a missed run-out sparked social media trolling ahead of their high-stakes final against India.

Surya asked to avoid political comments over Pak complaints at ICC hearing: Sources The ICC has advised India captain Suryakumar Yadav to avoid political statements after a PCB complaint over his tribute following the India-Pakistan group-stage clash. His dedication to Operation Sindoor and Pahalgam attack victims sparked controversy ahead of the Asia Cup final.

IND v SL preview: India face dead rubber dilemma ahead of Pakistan final Asia Cup, IND vs SL Super 4 preview: With the final against Pakistan looming, India find themselves caught in the classic dead rubber dilemma — to experiment or to consolidate. Friday's clash with Sri Lanka may not alter the standings, but it offers India a chance to settle questions over form, sharpen their fielding, and build the rhythm they need for the big showdown.

Smriti Mandhana eyes more records after stellar Australia series: Stats Preview Smriti Mandhana has delivered a stunning ODI series against Australia, breaking records with her explosive batting. She now aims for historic milestones at the upcoming Women's World Cup, raising expectations and excitement.

The Wall gets tougher: Sreejesh trades easygoing charm for coaching discipline From being a chill goalkeeper on the field to being a strict taskmaster on the halfway line, PR Sreejesh tells India Today about his coaching style, mentor role with SG Pipers and his ultimate goal as the senior team coach.

Watch: Fans troll Pakistan for fielding blunder vs Bangladesh ahead of India final Pakistan survived a shaky fielding performance to beat Bangladesh by 11 runs in the Asia Cup Super 4, but a missed run-out sparked social media trolling ahead of their high-stakes final against India.

IND vs PAK final: Pakistan coach urges players to focus on cricket amid off-field rowAhead of the Asia Cup 2025 final, Pakistan head coach Mike Hesson urges players to concentrate on cricket and avoid distractions from recent controversies. India and Pakistan will clash for the third time in this tournament.

Abhishek Sharma powerplay successor to Rohit Sharma: Mohammad Kaif on India openerMohammed Kaif believes that Abhishek Sharma has stepped into Rohit Sharma's shoes as India's powerplay enforcer. With fearless batting and consistent runs in the Asia Cup 2025, the youngster is shaping into a match-winner at the very top.

Mike Hesson's blueprint: How Pakistan plan to challenge India in Asia Cup finalAsia Cup 2025: Head coach Mike Hesson said Pakistan are capable of toppling India in Sunday's final. However, the New Zealand tactician cautioned his players that there are no shortcuts against the world's No. 1 side, stressing that being "good enough for long enough" is the only path to success.

England rout India by 153 runs in Women's World Cup warm-up fixture in BengaluruNat Sciver-Brunt scored a sparkling century as England defeated India by 153 runs in their warm-up match. India suffered a setback with Arundhati Reddy's injury ahead of the World Cup.

Salman Agha confident of avenging previous defeats vs India in Asia Cup finalPakistan captain Salman Agha expresses confidence in his men to beat India in the Asia Cup 2025 final. India have beaten Pakistan in both matches of the Asia Cup 2025 so far.

41 years, 17 Asia Cups later, it's an India vs Pakistan finalIndia and Pakistan will meet in the Asia Cup 2025 final for the first time ever. Pakistan qualified for the final with an 11-run victory over Bangladesh in their last Super 4 clash.

Sloppy Pakistan survive sloppier Bangladesh to book final date vs IndiaAsia Cup 2025: Pakistan were far from their best with the bat in the virtual semi-final against Bangladesh, but their bowling came to the rescue. For the first time in Asia Cup history, India and Pakistan will meet in the final on Sunday, 28 September.

World Para Athletics Champs underway in Delhi with PM Modi's motivational messageIndia proudly hosts the World Para Athletics Championships 2025 with over 2,200 athletes from 100 countries. They become the fourth Asian nation to host the World Para Athletics Championships, following Qatar (2015), the UAE (2019), and Japan (2024).

Salman Agha confident of avenging previous defeats vs India in Asia Cup finalPakistan captain Salman Agha expresses confidence in his men to beat India in the Asia Cup 2025 final. India have beaten Pakistan in both matches of the Asia Cup 2025 so far.

41 years, 17 Asia Cups later, it's an India vs Pakistan finalIndia and Pakistan will meet in the Asia Cup 2025 final for the first time ever. Pakistan qualified for the final with an 11-run victory over Bangladesh in their last Super 4 clash.

Sloppy Pakistan survive sloppier Bangladesh to book final date vs IndiaAsia Cup 2025: Pakistan were far from their best with the bat in the virtual semi-final against Bangladesh, but their bowling came to the rescue. For the first time in Asia Cup history, India and Pakistan will meet in the final on Sunday, 28 September.

World Para Athletics Champs underway in Delhi with PM Modi's motivational messageIndia proudly hosts the World Para Athletics Championships 2025 with over 2,200 athletes from 100 countries. They become the fourth Asian nation to host the World Para Athletics Championships, following Qatar (2015), the UAE (2019), and Japan (2024).

Archery: Sheetal targets gold at Para Worlds; historic all-Indian men's finalIndia has guaranteed at least three medals at the Para Archery World Championships 2025 with an all-India men's final and Sheetal Devi reaching the women's final in the compound category. 18-year-old Sheetal, who shoots with her legs, is bidding to win her maiden gold at the world meet.

Bumrah playing vs WI a missed opportunity to groom young fast bowler: PathanIrfan Pathan believes playing Jasprit Bumrah in both Tests against West Indies is a missed opportunity to develop young pacers. India and West Indies will play in a two-match Test series from October 2- October 14.

No words: Karun Nair reacts to India vs West Indies Test selection snubIND vs WI: Karun Nair expressed his disappointment after being omitted from India's Test squad for the West Indies tour. The Karnataka batter, who returned to the Test squad after eight years during the England series, struggled for consistency in the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy.

Kumar Sangakkara set to replace Rahul Dravid as head coach at Rajasthan RoyalsIPL 206: Kumar Sangakkara is set to Rajasthan Royals as head coach following Rahul Dravid's departure. The former Sri Lankan captain has been associated with the franchise as its Director of Cricket.

Duckayub: Pakistan youngster cops fans' wrath after 4th duck in 6 gamesYoung Pakistan batter Saim Ayub fell for his fourth duck in the Asia Cup on Thursday. Batting against Pakistan Ayub once again failed at the top of the batting order.

Suryakumar completes ICC hearing over Pakistan's complaint, decision on FridayThe PCB lodged a complaint against Suryakumar Yadav for dedicating India's 14 September win to the Armed Forces and the victims of the Pahalgam attack. It came in response to the BCCI's complaint to the ICC over Haris Rauf and Sahibzada Farhan's provocative gestures on 21 September.

Litton Das fails to recover for Pakistan clash, stars return for BangladeshAsia Cup, PAK vs BAN: Bangladesh will be without skipper Litton Das due to a rib injury, with Jaker Ali continuing as stand-in, and have made three changes to their XI after losing to India.

Jasprit Bumrah avoiding death overs? Pacer rejects Mohammad Kaif's takeIndia pacer Jasprit Bumrah called out Mohammad Kaif on X for inaccurate assessment of his fitness. Kaif had speculated that Bumrah is avoiding bowling in the death overs due to chances of injury.

IND A vs AUS A: Rahul, Sudharsan keep India in hunt for massive 412-run targetKL Rahul and Sai Sudharsan have kept India A in contention of chasing a massive target against Australia A. Rahul battled fever to score a sublime 74.

India A Women stun New Zealand after Shafali Verma heroics in warmupWomen's World Cup: India A Women edged out New Zealand Women in a thrilling warm-up match at Bengaluru, chasing 224 under the DLS method and winning by four wickets with three balls to spare.

Highlights: Pakistan set up final vs India with glorious win vs BangladeshPakistan (PAK) vs Bangladesh (BAN) Highlights, Asia Cup Super 4: Pakistan have set up Asia Cup final vs India with a riveting bowling performance against Bangladesh. Haris Rauf and Shaheen Shah Afridi have led their struggling team to the final of the continental tournament. Chasing 136, Bangladesh only managed 124/9 in their 20 overs.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
